info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 30 at 12:25AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Franklin, southeastern Stephens, northwestern Elbert, Hart, southeastern Greenville, Anderson, southern Pickens and southeastern Oconee Counties through 115 AM EST... At 1224 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles north of Clemson to 6 miles east of Homer. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Anderson, Clemson, Seneca, Hartwell, Carnesville, Simpsonville, Fountain Inn, Homeland Park, Piedmont and Belton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 AM EST for northeastern Georgia...and Upstate South Carolina.
